title: Brazil’s Lula met with protests in Portugal over Ukraine comments
description: The Brazilian leader's remarks, implying both Russia and Ukraine are at fault for their ongoing war, have stoked anger.

title: US Supreme Court upholds access to abortion pill mifepristone
description: The ruling preserves broad access to mifepristone, upholding the US Food and Drug Administration's approval of the pill.

title: Clashes in Sudan on Eid holiday despite truce announcements
description: Residents in Khartoum say fighting continued after the army announced a three-day truce for the Eid festival.

title: US prosecutors formally drop charges against Alec Baldwin
description: The actor faced charges in relation to the fatal 2021 shooting of a cinematographer on the set of the movie Rust.

title: What role do outside players have in the war in Sudan?
description: There are growing fears the violence could lead to a wider conflict.

title: Peru’s ex-President Toledo surrenders to face extradition from US
description: Alejandro Toledo is set to be extradited to Peru to face bribery-related charges in a  corruption investigation.

title: US jury hands Tesla sweeping win over Autopilot feature
description: The verdict that its Autopilot did not fail to perform safely is a big victory for Tesla as it braces for more trials.

title: French court convicts Canadian professor for synagogue bombing
description: Hassan Diab and his supporters say guilty verdict in fatal 1980 Paris attack amounts to a 'wrongful conviction'.

title: Extinction Rebellion launches four-day mass action in London
description: Activists take part in 'The Big One' event in UK capital to demand the government do more to tackle the climate crisis.

title: Mayorkas lays out ‘evolved’ US security threats: What to know
description: Dept of Homeland Security head says migration, artificial intelligence, China, and climate change are top priorities.

title: Canada and Volkswagen lay out plans for $15bn gigafactory
description: Canada wants to attract EV supply chain producers so its manufacturing sector can pivot to a low-carbon economy.

title: Russia downbeat on grain deal as Ukraine tries to unblock exports
description: Kyiv's prospects of unblocking grain exports to Eastern Europe improve as Romania opts against the ban on food imports.

title: What to know about the abortion pill mifepristone
description: The US Supreme Court is considering whether to uphold restrictions to the pill used in more than half of US abortions.

title: About half US Democrats want Joe Biden to run again: Poll
description: Democrats approve of job the president is doing and would back him, but they have concerns about his age, poll shows.

title: Why the conflict in Sudan is worrying its neighbours
description: Concerns range from water supplies and oil pipelines to a new humanitarian crisis in the making.

title: Argentina’s President Fernandez will not seek re-election
description: Alberto Fernandez says he will 'hand over the presidential sash' and not seek a second term in office in October polls.

title: South Africa evicts asylum seekers camped outside UN office
description: Africa's most industrialised nation is magnet for migrants, refugees but sees sporadic episodes of xenophobic violence.

title: ‘What?!’: Orban tweets frustration as NATO makes Ukraine promises
description: Hungary's outspoken populist leader takes to Twitter after Stoltenberg pledged Ukraine's eventual membership.

title: ‘Off the charts’: UN report highlights rapid climate breakdown
description: Sea level rises double, and greenhouse gases in the atmosphere hit a record, World Meteorological Organization warns.

title: Drop it America and Canada: A corn clash with Mexico helps no one
description: A brewing dispute over Mexican restrictions on some corn imports will only hurt farmers on all sides.

title: When and how will Ukraine start counteroffensive against Russia?
description: Western weapons pour into Ukraine as officials in Kyiv promise new attacks will start soon.

title: Protracted war predicted in Sudan with threat of intervention
description: Analysts warn the battle for capital Khartoum is expected to be long and bloody but the army should prevail.

title: Ten people dead as gunmen ambush family in South Africa
description: South Africa has one of the world's highest murder rates, with about 20,000 murders recorded every year.

title: Gold heist at Canada’s busiest airport estimated at $14m
description: A container carrying 'high-value' items was stolen after being unloaded from a plane at a cargo facility in Toronto.

title: UK Deputy Prime Minister Dominic Raab, accused of bullying, quits
description: Several of Raab's colleagues in Westminster had complained about his professional behaviour.

title: Who profits from the music genres created by Black artists?
description: Musician Jake Blount and author Mark Anthony Neal on Black music, exploitation and the US entertainment industry.

title: US deploys more troops to Djibouti for possible Sudan evacuation
description: US preparing to send additional troops to nearby Djibouti in case an evacuation of Americans from Sudan is needed.

title: Mehdi Hasan on the power of persuasion in a polarised world
description: 'We need to retake our public square. Democracy cannot survive if we can't have good-faith disagreements.'

title: Protest in Sri Lanka on fourth anniversary of Easter bombings
description: Thousands march to demand government uncover who real conspirators were behind attacks that killed nearly 270 people.

title: Russia accidentally bombs own city near Ukraine
description: At least three people were injured as a jet fired a weapon into the city of Belgorod, according to Russian state media.

title: Q&A: ‘Chilling’: Journalist sued by Adani, cited by Hindenburg
description: Veteran Indian journalist Paranjoy Guha Thakurta talks about his reporting, meeting Adani and the cases he faces.

title: Twitter drops ‘state-affiliated’, ‘government-funded’ labels
description: China's Xinhua and Russia's RT no longer labelled as state media after unannounced changes.

title: Lebanon’s political impasse continues despite Iran-Saudi deal
description: The Saudi-Iran rapprochement has yet to reflect on Lebanon’s political deadlock.

title: Fears Ghannouchi arrest will lead to more crackdowns in Tunisia
description: Opposition worried what President Kais Saied's next step will be with a number of opposition figures in prison.

title: G7 nations mulling near-total ban on exports to Russia: Kyodo
description: G7 nations reportedly discussing ban ahead of summit in Hiroshima next month.

title: Macron’s clumsy China views are worrying — because he isn’t alone
description: The French leader's comments highlight Europe's divisions on China. But they also raise questions for the Global South.

title: Pakistan sees sharp drop in Eid shopping due to soaring inflation
description: Retail sales for the festival witness sharp drop compared with previous years as inflation reaches 35 percent in March.

title: Lachlan Murdoch drops defamation suit against Australia’s Crikey
description: Move comes days after Fox News agreed to pay $787.5m over false claims the 2020 election was stolen from Donald Trump.

title: Five Indian soldiers killed in suspected rebel attack in Kashmir
description: Suspected rebels fighting against Indian rule in the disputed region ambush military vehicle in southern Rajouri sector.

title: Sudan’s RSF announces 72-hour ceasefire amid Khartoum fighting
description: World leaders have been calling on Sudan's warring factions to call a ceasefire for Eid al-Fitr which starts on Friday.

title: Twitter starts removing blue tick mark from non-paying users
description: Famous figures including Pope Francis and Bill Gates lose blue tick as Elon Musk pushes paid service.

title: Both sides of Taiwan Strait belong to China: Foreign Minister
description: Qin Gang reiterates Beijing's claim over the self-ruled democracy and denies country trying to change the status quo.

title: Russia-Ukaine war: List of key events, day 422
description: As the war enters its 422nd day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Indonesia’s sex workers organise, fight stigma and shame
description: Non-profit PERKAWIS supports sex workers with education about health, financial issues and the law.

title: Macron accused of ‘playing into Xi’s hands’ with Taiwan comments
description: French president might have been trying to caution against a bipolar world, but he left self-ruled Taiwan exposed.

title: Does India have enough insurance coverage for a nuclear disaster?
description: India has barely half the insurance amount required for current nuclear plants, and has many more plants in the works.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy addresses Mexican congress, denounces critics
description: Ukrainian president slammed politicians who seek 'some sort of populism' by dismissing his country's pursuit of peace.
